running Big Sur on a MacBook7,1

I made some contributions to the Big Sur patching effort, including the installer hacks used by barrykn's micropatcher and its derivatives. I'm working on non-Metal acceleration fixes, which can be found in OpenCore Legacy Patcher. They will be open-sourced in mid-2021.



I also plan to eventually release a MacBook7,1-specific tool that I wrote for personal use.

posts on MacRumors

Links to some of my relevant posts on the MacRumors thread.
  • The idiotically-named Hax.dylib: initial post, anti-sealing update, APFS hack, update for use when booted into Big Sur, update for 11.3 DP5
  • Snapshot/sealing notes: apfs_systemsnapshot, summary, ramrod patch and update for DP3
  • boot.efi patching notes
  • KC rebuild steps
  • gdmf.apple.com tool, DP7 update notes
